SubTopics: Express very large and very small quantities in scientific notation and approximate how many times larger one is than the other.
Content: On average, the moon is 384,400 kilometers from the Earth. How is this distance written in scientific notation?

SubTopics: Solve equations of the form x² = p and x³ = p, where p is a positive rational number.
Content: An equation is shown.
:ibox:x³ = 125
What are all the possible values of x?

C.Choice: –5 and 5

SubTopics: Estimate the value and compare the size of irrational numbers and approximate their locations on a number line.
Content: For each number, select the interval in which the number is located.

SubTopics: Perform operations with numbers expressed in scientific notation, including problems where both decimal and scientific notation are used.
Content: In a science lab, substance X has a mass of 6.10 × 10⁻⁷ grams. The mass of substance Y is twice as much as that of substance X. What is the mass, in grams, of substance Y?

SubTopics: Explain why systems of linear equations can have one solution, no solution or infinitely many solutions.
Content: A system of equations is shown.
How many solutions does the system have, and why?

A.Choice: There are no solutions because the slopes and y-intercepts are the same.

B.Choice: There are infinitely many solutions because the slopes and y-intercepts are the same.

C.Choice: There are no solutions because the slopes are the same and the y-intercepts are different.

D.Choice: There are infinitely many solutions because the slopes are the same and the y-intercepts are different.

SubTopics: Verify that angle measure, betweeness, collinearity and distance are preserved under rigid transformations.
Content: Figure 1 is rotated 90° counterclockwise about the origin to form Figure 2.
problems/MOG8M/media/6a.jpg
Select the THREE statements that are correct.

C.Choice: ∠C ≅ ∠T

SubTopics: Evaluate square roots of perfect squares less than or equal to 625 and cube roots of perfect cubes less than or equal to 1000.
Content: The dance floor at a hotel is in the shape of a square. The area of the ballroom floor is 576 square meters. To find the length, in meters, of each side of the dance floor, Jolie evaluates the expression shown.
:ibox:√576
What is the length, in meters, of each side of the dance floor?

SubTopics: Know and apply the properties of integer exponents to generate equivalent expressions.
Content: Select the THREE expressions that are equal to 1.

SubTopics: Describe the functional relationship between two quantities from a graph or a verbal description.
Content: Jonathan goes to a baseball game. At the beginning of each of the nine innings in the game, he estimates the percentage of seats in his section that are full. He makes a graph to show the relationship between the inning, x, and the percentage of seats in his section that are full, y.
problems/MOG8M/media/9a.jpg
Which statement about the section in which Jonathan sits at the baseball game is most likely true?

A.Choice: Most of the fans left during the eighth inning.

B.Choice: The greatest number of fans arrived during the second inning.

C.Choice: There was at least one point during the game in which Jonathan's section was 100% full.

D.Choice: The same seats were full at the beginning of the third inning as at the beginning of the sixth inning.

SubTopics: Understand the concept of surface area and find surface area of pyramids.
Content: A square pyramid has a base that is 4 inches wide and a slant height of 7 inches. What is the surface area, in square inches, of the pyramid?

SubTopics: Recognize that the graph of a linear function has a constant rate of change.
Content: Which graph shows a linear function?

C.Choice: problems/MOG8M/media/11c.jpg

SubTopics: Derive the equation y = mx for a line through the origin and the equation y = mx + b for a line intercepting the vertical axis at b.
Content: Lucy has a lemonade stand. The table shows Lucy's profits when she sells different amounts of lemonade.
problems/MOG8M/media/12a.jpg
Which equation could Lucy use to determine her profit, y, when she sells x cups of lemonade?

C.Choice: u = x

SubTopics: Determine the x-intercept of a linear function.
Content: The equation shows the average cost, y, in dollars, of electricity per kilowatt hour (kWh) used, x, for homes in the state of Missouri in 2011.
:ibox:y = x/10
Based on the equation, what would be the cost, in dollars, for a home using 0 kWh of electricity in 2011?

SubTopics: Graph systems of linear equations and recognize the intersection as the solution to the system.
Content: The graph of a system of equations is shown on the coordinate plane.
problems/MOG8M/media/14a.jpg
What is the solution to the system of equations?

SubTopics: Generate and use a trend line for bivariate data, and informally assess the fit of the line.
Content: Mr. Rose surveyed his students about the amounts of time they spent studying for his final exam and their final exam scores. He graphed the results on a coordinate plane. Which graph shows the BEST approximation of the line of best fit for Mr. Rose's data?

C.Choice: problems/MOG8M/media/15c.jpg

SubTopics: Compare characteristics of two functions each represented in a different way.
Content: Function 1 is shown on the coordinate plane.
problems/MOG8M/media/16a.jpg
Function 2 is represented by the equation y= 3x+ 1. Which statement about the rate of change is correct?

A.Choice: Function 1 has a greater rate of change.

B.Choice: Function 2 has a greater rate of change.

C.Choice: Both functions have the same rate of change.

D.Choice: There is not enough information to determine which function has the greater rate of change.

SubTopics: Use the Pythagorean Theorem to determine unknown side lengths in right triangles in problems in two- and three-dimensional contexts.
Content: At the zoo, the aquarium is 36 feet north of the gift shop. The monkey habitat is 323 feet east of the gift shop. What is the distance, in feet, from the aquarium to the monkey habitat?

SubTopics: Compare two different proportional relationships.
Content: Barry and Omar each sell potato salad in their sandwich shops. Barry uses the graph shown to determine the total cost for different amounts of potato salad.
problems/MOG8M/media/18a.jpg
Omar uses the equation y = 2.89x to determine the total cost, y, in dollars, for x pounds of potato salad. Which statement about the cost of potato salad at Barry's and Omar's sandwich shops is true?

A.Choice: The cost per pound at Barry's sandwich shop is less than the cost per pound at Omar's sandwich shop.

B.Choice: The cost per pound at Omar's sandwich shop is less than the cost per pound at Barry's sandwich shop.

C.Choice: The cost per pound at the cheaper sandwich shop depends on how many pounds of potato salad a customer purchases.

D.Choice: It is impossible to determine which sandwich shop charges less per pound based on the given information.

SubTopics: Describe the effect of dilations, translations, rotations and reflections on two-dimensional figures using coordinates.
Content: Quadrilateral ABCD is translated to form quadrilateral A'B'C'D'.
problems/MOG8M/media/19a.jpg
How can the translation of quadrilateral ABCD to quadrilateral A'B'C'D' be described using coordinates?

SubTopics: Interpret the equation y = mx + b as defining a linear function, whose parameters are the slope (m) and the y-intercept (b).
Content: Beth earns $35,000 per year at her job as a salesperson. She also earns 15% of her total sales for the year. She writes the function shown to represent the total amount of money she earns each year, y, in dollars, as a function of her total sales for the year, x, in dollars.
For each statement in the table, select whether it is true or false.

SubTopics: Derive the sum of the interior angles of a triangle.
Content: The figure shows a large triangle divided into two smaller triangles.
problems/MOG8M/media/21a.jpg
What is the value of xin the figure?

SubTopics: Construct and interpret a two-way table summarizing data on two categorical variables collected from the same subjects.
Content: Henry surveys 80 people. He asks each person two questions:

:ibox:• Have you ever taken a taxi?
• Have you ever visited another state?
He makes the two-way table to show the results of his survey.
problems/MOG8M/media/22a.jpg
Complete each sentence with “more likely”, “less likely”, or “equally as likely” based on the results from Henry's survey.
A random person from Henry's survey is :DD-1: to have taken a taxi than to have NOT taken a taxi.
A random person from Henry's survey who has taken a taxi is :DD-2: to have visited another state than to have NOT visited another state.
A random person from Henry's survey who has NOT visited another state is :DD-3: to have taken a taxi than to have NOT taken a taxi.

SubTopics: Use the properties of similar figures to solve problems.
Content: A rug has two quadrilaterals woven into its design. On a diagram, the smaller quadrilateral is labeled GHIJ. The second quadrilateral, labeled KLMN, is a dilation of GHIJ. Quadrilateral GHIJ is similar to quadrilateral KLMN. Select the TWO statements that MUST be true.

A.Choice: Angle G is congruent to angle H.

B.Choice: Angle G is congruent to angle K.

C.Choice: If the length of side KL = 2GH, then 2MN = IJ.

D.Choice: The sum of angles H and I is equal to the sum of angles K and L.

E.Choice: The sum of angles G, H, and I is equal to the sum of angles K, L, and M.

SubTopics: Create and identify linear equations with one solution, infinitely many solutions or no solutions.
Content: Which linear equation has no solution?

SubTopics: Interpret the equation y = mx + b as defining a linear function, whose parameters are the slope (m) and the y-intercept (b).
Content: A linear equation is shown.
:ibox:y = 2x/3 – 4
What is the y-intercept of the graph of the equation?

SubTopics: Construct and explore the angles created when parallel lines are cut by a transversal.
Content: In the figure, lines j and k are parallel to one another. Line m intersects both parallel lines to create 8 numbered angles, none of which are right angles.
problems/MOG8M/media/26a.jpg
Garrett measures angles 1 and 6. He says the measure of angle 1 is 65° and the measure of angle 6 is 125°. Jennifer claims Garrett is incorrect. Which statement could Jennifer use to prove her claim?

A.Choice: Angles 1 and 4 are congruent, and the sum of the measures of angles 4 and 6 must be 180°.

B.Choice: Angles 1 and 3 are congruent, and the sum of the measures of angles 3 and 6 must be 180°.

C.Choice: Angles 1 and 7 are supplementary, and the sum of the measures of angles 6 and 7 must be 180°.

D.Choice: Angles 2 and 6 are supplementary, and the sum of the measures of angles 1 and 2 must be 180°.

SubTopics: Perform operations with numbers expressed in scientific notation, including problems where both decimal and scientific notation are used.
Content: An expression is shown.
Write an equivalent expression in scientific notation.

SubTopics: Convert decimals which repeat into fractions and fractions into repeating decimals.
Content: Write the equivalent fraction for the repeating decimal 0.636363...

SubTopics: Graph a function.
Content: The table shows four input values and their associated output values.
problems/MOG8M/media/29a.jpg
Which graph represents the function shown in the table?

C.Choice: problems/MOG8M/media/29d.jpg

SubTopics: Interpret the unit rate as the slope of the graph.
Content: Bill mows 21 lawns per week. Which graph has a slope that represents the number of lawns Bill mows per DAY?

C.Choice: problems/MOG8M/media/30c.jpg

SubTopics: Describe a possible sequence of rigid transformations between two congruent figures.
Content: Triangle ABC and triangle A'B'C' are shown on the coordinate plane.
problems/MOG8M/media/31a.jpg
Which sequence of transformations maps triangle ABC onto triangle A'B'C'?

A.Choice: a rotation of 180 degrees and then a translation left 1 unit

B.Choice: a translation left 5 units and then a reflection over the x-axis

C.Choice: a reflection over the y-axis and then a translation down 8 units

D.Choice: a reflection over the x-axis and then a reflection over the y-axis

SubTopics: Describe the effect of dilations, translations, rotations and reflections on two-dimensional figures using coordinates.
Content: The graph of a line is shown.
problems/MOG8M/media/32a.jpg
Write an equation in SLOPE-INTERCEPT FORM that represents the graphed line.

SubTopics: Know the differences between rational and irrational numbers.
Content: A marching band director draws the triangle shown to represent the band's formation at the beginning of a song.
problems/MOG8M/media/33a.jpg
The marching band director wants the formation to rotate 90° clockwise about the origin once the song starts. Draw a triangle to represent the formation of the band after the rotation.

SubTopics: Know the differences between rational and irrational numbers.
Content: Select the THREE rational numbers.

SubTopics: Understand the concepts of volume and find the volume of pyramids, cones and spheres.
Content: A pile of gravel is in the shape of a cone. The radius of the pile of gravel is 9 feet at the base. The height of the pile of gravel is 8 feet. What is the volume of gravel, in cubic feet, in the pile?

SubTopics: Solve linear equations and inequalities with rational number coefficients, including equations and inequalities whose solutions require expanding expressions using the distributive property and combining like terms.
Content: Kayla sells hats at a store for gift cards.

:ibox:• Kayla already has $42.50 in gift cards at the store.
• The hats Kayla sells have a cash value of x dollars.
• The store pays an additional 30% when hats are sold for gift cards rather than for cash.
• After selling the hats for gift cards, Kayla has $140.26 in gift cards at the store.
To determine the cash value of the hats she sells, Kayla writes the equation 42.5 + x + 0.3x = 140.26. What is the cash value of the hats Kayla sells?

SubTopics: Explain the parameters of a linear function based on the context of a problem.
Content: The water in a barrel is 24 inches deep. When the plug is pulled out of the barrel, the water depth is reduced 3 inches each hour. Owen creates an equation in the form of y = mx + b to represent the height of the water in the barrel after the plug has been removed. What should be the slope, m, of Owen's equation and what does it mean?

A.Choice: The slope is 24 because that is the amount of water in the barrel at the beginning.

B.Choice: The slope is –24 because that is the amount of water in the barrel at the beginning.

C.Choice: The slope is 3 because the depth of the water in the barrel is decreasing by 3 inches per hour.

D.Choice: The slope is –3 because the depth of the water in the barrel is decreasing by 3 inches per hour.

SubTopics: Use models to demonstrate a proof of the Pythagorean Theorem and its converse.
Content: Three sides of a triangle measure 25 inches, 24 inches, and 7 inches. Which statement about the side lengths is correct?

A.Choice: The side lengths create a right triangle, because 7 + 24 > 25.

B.Choice: The side lengths create a right triangle, because 7² + 24² = 25².

C.Choice: The side lengths do not create a right triangle, because 7 + 24 ≠ 25.

D.Choice: The side lengths do not create a right triangle, because 7² + 24² > 25².

SubTopics: Explain why solution(s) to a system of two linear equations in two variables correspond to point(s) of intersection of the graphs.
Content: An amusement park sells adult tickets and child tickets. Adult tickets cost more than child tickets. Heather purchased 10 tickets for $71 to give to her family. She created the system of equations shown to model this situation.
The solution to Heather's system is (3, 7). Which statement correctly interprets this solution?

A.Choice: Heather purchased 7 child tickets and 3 adult tickets.

B.Choice: Heather purchased 3 child tickets and 7 adult tickets.

C.Choice: Each child ticket costs $7 and each adult ticket costs $3.

D.Choice: Each child ticket costs $3 and each adult ticket costs $7.

SubTopics: Use relative frequencies calculated for rows or columns to describe possible association between the two variables.
Content: Sarah surveyed 100 people. She asked each person two questions:

:ibox:• Do you listen to jazz?
• Do you play a musical instrument?
Sarah made the following two-way table to display information about the responses.
problems/MOG8M/media/40a.jpg
Of the people Sarah surveyed who listen to jazz, what is the probability that a randomly selected person also plays a musical instrument?

SubTopics: Solve systems of two linear equations.
Content: Shaun is doing a science experiment. He has x liters of a solution that is 50% salt. He has y liters of a different solution that is 10% salt. He combines the two solutions together and ends up with 4 liters of a solution that is 35% salt. To represent this situation, he writes the system of equations shown.
Which ordered pair represents the number of liters of each of the two solutions Shaun started with?

SubTopics: Give examples of nonlinear functions.
Content: Select the TWO nonlinear functions.

SubTopics: Graph systems of linear equations and recognize the intersection as the solution to the system.
Content: Jerry buys gray modeling clay and pink modeling clay. Gray modeling clay costs $4 per pound. Pink modeling clay costs $5 per pound. Jerry orders a total of 14 pounds of modeling clay for $60. To represent this situation, Jerry writes the system of equations shown.

In his system, x represents the number of pounds of gray modeling clay Jerry buys and y represents the number of pounds of pink modeling clay Jerry buys. Plot a point to represent the number of pounds of each type of modeling clay Jerry buys.

SubTopics: Interpret the parameters of a linear model of bivariate measurement data to solve problems.
Content: Students from various grades were surveyed about the number of sit-ups they could each complete in one minute. The results are shown on the scatterplot.
problems/MOG8M/media/44a.jpg
The line y = 2.8x + 3.9 can be used as a line of best fit for the data. Select the THREE statements about the data that make sense in the context of the situation.

A.Choice: A student in grade 3 should be expected to complete about 4 sit-ups in one minute.

B.Choice: A student in grade 4 should be expected to complete about 15 sit-ups in one minute.

C.Choice: A student in grade 10 should be expected to complete about 32 sit-ups in one minute.

D.Choice: Each time a student moves on to the next grade, that student should be expected to complete about 3 MORE sit-ups in one minute.

E.Choice: Each time a student moves on to the next grade, that student should be expected to complete about 4 MORE sit-ups in one minute.

F.Choice: Each time a student moves on to the next grade, that student should be expected to complete about 7 MORE sit-ups in one minute.

SubTopics: Explain why the slope (m) is the same between any two distinct points on a non-vertical line in the Cartesian coordinate plane.
Content: Which statement explains why the slope between any two points of a linear graph is the same?

A.Choice: The sum of the y-coordinates divided by the sum of the x-coordinates of any two points is the same.

B.Choice: The difference of the y-coordinates divided by the difference of the x-coordinates of any two points is the same.

C.Choice: The sum of the x- and y-coordinates of one point divided by the sum of the x- and y-coordinates of another point is the same for any two points.

D.Choice: The difference of the x- and y-coordinates of one point divided by the difference of the x- and y-coordinates of another point is the same for any two points.

SubTopics: Use the Pythagorean Theorem to find the distance between points in a Cartesian coordinate system.
Content: Rounded to the nearest whole number, what is the distance, in units, between (–3, 2) and (2, –8)?

SubTopics: Analyze and solve linear equations and inequalities and pairs of simultaneous linear equations.
Content: An equation with one solution is shown.
Solve the equation for x.
Change the coefficient of the underlined term in the equation so that it has no solution. Show or explain how you determined that the equation has no solution.

SubTopics: Define, evaluate and compare functions.
Content: An employee of a company earns a base amount for each week of work plus an hourly rate. The manager of the employee spilled some ink on a table that shows the employee's weekly earnings, in dollars, for different numbers of hours of work. The table is shown below.
problems/PA15G8M/media/48a.jpg

What are the unknown values in the table? Use the table to create an equation to represent the employee's earnings, y, in dollars, for x hours of work. Then use your equation to calculate the number of hours the employee would need to work to earn $311. Be sure to show all your calculations.
Fill in the unknown values in the table?
Use the table to create an equation to represent the employee's earnings, y, in dollars, for x hours of work.
Then use your equation to calculate the number of hours the employee would need to work to earn $311. Be sure to show all your calculations.
